summary: This is a victim impact statement submitted for the sentencing of Ghislaine Maxwell. The victim describes being recruited in New York at age 22, then being sexually exploited by Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell for 7-8 months at locations including Epstein's New York mansion and private island. The statement details the psychological trauma and Maxwell's role as Epstein's chief recruiter and enabler.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Jeffrey Epstein's 'righthand woman' and the 'Five Star General' of recruiters who enabled his sexual predation. The victim states Maxwell was instrumental in luring and trapping her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a wealthy philanthropist who, with Maxwell, targeted vulnerable young women for sexual exploitation. The victim was subjected to his predation multiple times daily.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's 'righthand woman' who managed recruiters and provided the means and cover for his sexual predation.
Both are identified as perpetrators who jointly targeted, recruited, and sexually exploited the victim and hundreds of other girls and young women.

events.title: Victim's Recruitment and Exploitation
events.description: The victim, age 22, was recruited by an Epstein-Maxwell recruiter in a New York club and subsequently exploited for 7-8 months, subjected to sexual predation multiple times per day.

events.title: Escape Attempt on Private Island
events.description: During a visit to Epstein's private island, Little St. James, the victim attempted to escape sexual abuse by jumping off a cliff into shark-infested waters but was caught by Maxwell and others.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial

keyFacts: The victim states she was a sex toy used to entertain Epstein, Maxwell, and others for 7-8 months, sometimes subjected to predation multiple times per day.
Maxwell is characterized as the 'Five Star General' of recruiters who provided the means and cover for Epstein's predation.
The victim attempted suicide by jumping off a cliff on Epstein's island to escape the abuse but was caught by Maxwell and others.
Epstein and Maxwell are described as masters at finding and exploiting young, vulnerable girls by initially offering help and gifts before ensnaring them.
The victim states the accurate count of victims will never be known, implying there were hundreds.
